text:
Conservatives like to set up this false dichotomy of ‘women who have abortions’ and ‘women who are mothers’. 

But 59% of women who have abortions are moms - a major reason given for having the procedure is wanting to be a good parent to the children they already have.

text: Anyway, much love and support to the women who tell their stories despite knowing that assholes will attack them in bad faith. They're putting themselves on the line for the rest of us, and I am so grateful.

text: Alexandra's tweet is particularly disgusting because she (falsely) argued in her Atlantic piece that women don't really get later abortions because of fetal abnormalities. But when faced with a real person who wants to be heard, she dismisses her as "waxing poetic."

text: This complete disconnect from the reality of pregnancy, childbirth & family tragedy is exactly how you know this has nothing to do with what's best for women or children.
author: JessicaValenti

text:
First of all, the GOP is bankrupting parents with kids in the NICU - stays that cost literally millions of dollars. 

And the incredibly complex moral decision to extend or withdraw care to a preemie that young can never be made by lawmakers. The idea is vile.
author: JessicaValenti

text:
As the mom of a 28 week preemie, tho, it was this I found most galling: "At 24 weeks, and now even as early as 21 weeks, newborn infants have survived outside the womb with the help of neonatal intensive care." 

You have no idea what it means to have a child that early. NONE.
author: JessicaValenti

text: Most amazingly, there is no mention that the study linked to shows that women seek out abortions after 20 weeks BECAUSE of the limitations created by Republicans: insurance probs, geographical access, delays, etc
author: JessicaValenti

text: That's either a very sloppy mistake or a deliberate attempt to define abortions at 20 weeks as "late term"
author: JessicaValenti

text: In addition to obvious errors that could have been prevented with some fact-checking, the author writes about "third trimester abortions" while linking to research about abortion post-20 weeks (which is about when you get an ultrasound for fetal abnormalities)
author: JessicaValenti

text: Who ever edited that Atlantic piece on "late-term abortions" should be embarrassed

text: They know that late term abortions are incredible rare and done to save women's lives or because of severe fetal abnormalities. But so long as people are talking about "abortion at nine months!" no one is thinking about the laws they're writing to mandate motherhood

text: It's telling that conservative men are tweeting about nonexistent abortions at "40 weeks" or "outside the womb" (?!) as the GOP pushes deeply unpopular 6 week bans - it's a strategy to distract from the fact that they're trying to outlaw all abortion under any circumstances

text: Responses to this piece already proving my point: "The assumption, once again, will be that caring about the gender of the candidate means that it’s your only concern — as if it’s not possible to weigh gender the same way you do any other factor when you vote."

text: The truth is that a vote for a man is far more tainted by bias — generations of patriarchy, to be exact — than any vote for a female leader.

text: I honestly haven't stopped thinking about that MAGA kid all day - in part because I think so many of us have been on the receiving end of the face he was making: a smug, untouchable, entitled 'fuck you'.

text: I'm willing to bet that fifty years from now, a defining image of this political era will be that smug white MAGA teen disrespecting a Native elder and veteran. It just captures so much.
